Trial_Design.evidence: This randomized, blinded study involved 60 patients

Participants.evidence: Inclusion criteria were primary hip arthritis, female sex, and age between 55 and 70 years.

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive a 28-, 36-, or â‰¥ 42-mm bearing couple

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized a larger femoral head would restore an earlier, more physiologic gait pattern.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Gait evaluation using an optoelectronic system was performed preoperatively and at 2 and 4 months postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The patients were randomized into three groups of 20 each

Number_Randomised.evidence: The patients were randomized into three groups of 20 each

Result_Outcome.evidence: no differences in spatiotemporal gait parameters, kinematic or kinetic gait parameters, or Harris hip scores emerged among the three groups
